business.headline: Is Diwali bonus taxable for salaried employees? Here's what you must knowAs Diwali draws near, salaried employees across India look forward to festive bonuses and gifts. But not all perks are tax-free, and understanding which ones attract tax is essential to avoid surprises from the Income Tax Department.

LG Electronics IPO GMP rises: Can investors expect 50% listing pop tomorrow?LG IPO: While early chatter hinted at a 50% listing pop, current indicators suggest a slightly more modest, yet still impressive, gain. Read on to know more about the grey market trends, subscription frenzy, and what investors can realistically expect tomorrow.

Cryto rebounds after massive crash. Here's what investors should doThe crypto market has regained lost ground following a sharp crash over the weekend. Bitcoin, Ethereum, and several altcoins are bouncing back, leaving investors to decide their next move carefully.

Gold prices climb again. Will the rally continue till Dhanteras?Gold is once again on the rise, drawing attention from investors and festive buyers alike. With prices touching record levels and global uncertainty at play, many are now wondering if the momentum will carry through to Dhanteras.

Why Tata Capital's weak stock market debut isn't a reason to worryTata Capital IPO: The shares opened at Rs 330 on listing day, roughly 1% above the IPO price of Rs 326—a flat, polite start for what was billed as the biggest public issue of the year.
Tata Capital share price: 2025's biggest IPO makes flat debut on stock marketTata Capital shares listed at Rs 330 on both the NSE and the BSE, opening at a premium of just 1% over its issue price.

Sensex tumbles nearly 400 points: Why is the stock market falling today?Across Asia, markets opened lower, and India wasn't spared either. Profit booking after last week's gains and cautious sentiment ahead of key domestic events like the Tata Capital listing, Q2 earnings, and inflation data added to the drag.

LG Electronics IPO set for a bumper listing tomorrow? Check latest GMPLG Electronics IPO was open for subscription from October 7 to October 9 and saw strong participation across all investor categories.

Sensex, Nifty fall amid US-China tariff tensions; focus on Tata Capital listingThe S&P BSE Sensex fell over 300 points in early trade, while the NSE Nifty50 slipped around 100 points amid mild profit booking after last week's gains.

Tata Capital share listing today: Will investors see profit from biggest IPO in 2025?The Rs 15,511.87 crore IPO, which opened for subscription on October 6 and closed on October 8, received bids for 65.33 crore shares against 33.34 crore shares on offer, subscribing 1.96 times overall.

What's in a Will? Understanding the power of your last wordFrom Bollywood dramas where brothers turn against each other to real-life stories of families dragged into courtrooms, most of these disputes begin with one missing document, a will.

Why Indians still prefer buying homes during auspicious monthsBuying a home in India is more than just a financial decision — it is an emotional milestone. For many, choosing the right time to invest is as important as picking the right property, with festivals and auspicious dates playing a big role.

Crypto crash wipes out $19 billion after Trump's 100% China tariffs spark sell-offThe cryptocurrency market suffered a historic crash after US President Donald Trump announced 100% tariffs on China and new export controls on software.

Crisis brews at Bira 91: How a name change shook the popular beer brandFrom beer icon to regulatory nightmare, Bira 91's journey shows how a minor administrative tweak can spiral into financial chaos, employee unrest, and investor anxiety.

LG Electronics vs Tata Capital IPO: What should be your strategy post-listing?Two IPOs, two very different strategies. Tata Capital offers steady long-term growth, while LG Electronics promises quick listing gains. Read on to plan post-listing moves and investment approach carefully.

LG Electronics IPO allotment is finally out. How much listing gain you can expect?Investors who received allotments may be sitting on potential listing gains of Rs 5,000–Rs 6,000 per lot, depending on market sentiment at the time of debut.

Anil Ambani aide and senior Reliance Power executive arrested by EDThe arrest of Ashok Pal, who serves as the executive director at Reliance Power, is related to a suspected fake bank guarantee racket worth Rs 68.2 crore.

Tata History: When Nehru, Jinnah, and Bose allied to save steel companyStarting as a company trading in cotton and opium, the Tata Group has weathered colonial economic warfare, nationalist politics, labor upheaval, and insurgent crises. But it has always emerged stronger through vision, sacrifice, and resilience. In the final episode of our series on the group, we revisit two storms that threatened to sink the Tata brand and image.
Sensex, Nifty end higher as financial stocks rally; Cipla, SBI among top gainersSensex ends 328 points higher, Nifty above 25,250; Cipla, SBI lead gains

Convenience or debt trap? The hidden cost of BPNL, easy credit and festive offersEvery festive season, easy credit makes everything—from gadgets to holidays—look affordable. But behind the glitter of BNPL schemes and "no-cost EMIs" lies a growing debt trap that's quietly eroding financial freedom.

entertainment.headline: Taylor Swift's first public outing post-engagement? A Chiefs game, of course Taylor Swift seen at Kansas City Chiefs game after announcing engagement to Travis Kelce. Swift shares insights on upcoming album inspired by her Eras Tour experiences.

Preity Zinta-Bobby Deol's sweet pose sums up Diwali warmth at bash. Video Preity Zinta and Bobby Deol's heartwarming reunion at Manish Malhotra's Diwali bash stole the spotlight. The 'Soldier' duo shared a friendly punch, warm hug, and surprise pose for the paparazzi, perfectly capturing the spirit of festive cheer and nostalgia.

Bigg Boss Kannada 12: Kichcha Sudeep warns contestants of mass eviction The second week of Bigg Boss Kannada Season 12, hosted by Kiccha Sudeep, ended with no evictions, and contestant duo Malu Nipanal and Spandana were declared finalists for the upcoming week's first finale.

Priyanka Mohan to star in Netflix's Tamil film Made in Korea, 1st look poster out Netflix's announced a new Tamil film 'Made in Korea' that blends South Indian warmth with Korean charm, tracing a young woman's journey of love and self-discovery in Seoul. It stars Priyanka Mohan in the lead role and is directed by Ra Karthik.

Annu Kapoor faces online backlash after remarks on Tamannaah's 'milky body' Actor Annu Kapoor has come under fire for comments about Tamannaah Bhatia's appearance in a recent interview. Social media users called his statements lewd, sparking widespread criticism and debate over respect in public discourse.

Kantara Chapter 1 is India's 12th biggest hit, outperforms Baahubali 1 in 11 days 'Kantara: Chapter 1' overtook 'Baahubali: The Beginning' in box office rankings to become the 12th highest grossing film in India. It grossed Rs 600 crore globally and is continuing its dream run.

Priyanka Chopra, Nick Jonas dazzle at All That Glitters Diwali Bash in New York Priyanka Chopra and Nick Jonas attended a pre-Diwali celebration in New York hosted by Anjula Acharia. The event brought together prominent personalities from the Bollywood and Hollywood fraternities.

Elliot Page on reuniting with Nolan for The Odyssey, same emotions as Inception Actor Elliot Page is set to join the star-studded cast of the upcoming epic 'The Odyssey'. While opening up on the secretive script reading process, he recalled his experience on 'Inception' and hinted at a thrilling project ahead.

KBC 17: The Rs 25,000 Ramayana question that stumped 5th grader Ishit Bhatt Fifth-grader Ishit Bhatt from Gandhinagar, Gujarat, went viral after losing a Rs 25,000 Ramayana question on 'Kaun Banega Crorepati 17'. Despite his confidence, the young contestant couldn't answer the question about Valmiki's Ramayana, prompting host Amitabh Bachchan to share a message on overconfidence.

Meet the voices behind Gachiakuta: How anime found its Indian resonance In an exclusive interview, 'Gachiakuta's Hindi voice cast, Rohan Jadhav, Nirav Vyas, and Aniket Khadye, talk about bringing emotional depth and authenticity to the anime's dark, philosophical world.

Takshakudu: Anand Deverakonda, Nitanshi Goel team up for Netflix's Telugu actioner Actors Anand Deverakonda and Nitanshi Goel have teamed up for a Telugu actioner. Titled, 'Takshakudu', the announcement was made on Monday, October 13.

Kiku Sharda and Aditya Narayan exit Rise & Fall in double elimination Kiku Sharda and Aditya Narayan were eliminated from 'Rise & Fall' in a double elimination twist. Their exit has reshaped the competition as remaining contestants prepare for the final showdown.

Akshay Kumar's comically warns newcomers, references The Ba***ds of Bollywood Akshay Kumar advised newcomers at the 70th Filmfare Awards to avoid three-film deals with producers. The actor referenced Aryan Khan's directorial debut, 'The Ba***ds of Bollywood', to illustrate industry challenges.
Ramya Moksha to Madhuri Duvvala: Meet 6 wildcard contestants of Bigg Boss Telugu 9 Six wild cards have entered the Bigg Boss Telugu 9 house, bringing fresh drama, surprises, and intense competition.

Singer Chinmayi criticises X users for trolling young KBC kid: Horrible bullies Singer Chinmayi Sripaada condemned adults for targeting a child from Kaun Banega Crorepati for his 'disrespectful' behaviour with Amitabh Bachchan. She questioned the online ecosystem behind the trolling.

Tara Sutaria, Veer Pahariya's hand-in-hand entry wins hearts at Manish Malhotra's bash Actors Tara Sutaria and Veer Pahariya made their first red carpet appearance together at Manish Malhotra's Diwali bash. The two were clicked posing hand-in-hand for the paparazzi.

Salman Khan admits it was his misunderstanding that led to issues with Arijit Salman Khan addressed his rumoured feud with Arijit Singh on 'Bigg Boss 19'. The actor clarified that the misunderstanding was on his side, not Arijit's. Both confirmed continued collaboration in recent and upcoming films.

Rishab Shetty filmed Kantara Chapter 1 climax despite swollen legs, exhaustion Kantara: Chapter 1's climactic scene was shot by Rishab Shetty despite severe physical challenges, showcasing his unwavering dedication. The film's prequel involved an extensive creative process with numerous drafts, highlighting the depth behind this cinematic journey.

Deepika's 8-hour shift demand: She should get what she wants, says Shalini Pandey Shalini Pandey praises Deepika Padukone's commitment to mental health and work reforms. The discussion highlights ongoing industry changes supporting new mothers and professional balance.

general news.headline: Gaza deal takes effect as Hamas releases all Israeli hostages; Trump in Israel Live UpdatesHamas on Monday released 20 Israeli live hostages in two phases. In the first phase, seven hostages were handed over to the Red Cross and in the second phase, the remaining 13 were released.

Lalu Yadav, Rabri, Tejashwi to face trial in IRCTC scam in big court setbackLalu Yadav has been accused of criminal misconduct and conspiracy in manipulating tenders and land deals in the IRCTC scam, while Rabri Devi and Tejashwi face charges of cheating and conspiracy.

PM skips Gaza peace summit in Sharm el-Sheikh. Who does he not want to meet?Minister of State Kirti Vardhan Singh will represent India at the high-level summit co-chaired by the US and Egyptian Presidents, where over 20 world leaders will meet to finalise the framework of the Gaza peace deal and discuss post-war reconstruction.

These 3 top Delhi malls may shut down in coming daysThree of South Delhi's most prominent malls, DLF Promenade, DLF Emporio, and Ambience Mall in Vasant Kunj, are on the brink of closure due to a severe water crisis.

Did Suresh Gopi hint at filmy exit right after taking oath as minister?A year after creating history as Kerala's first BJP MP, Union Minister Suresh Gopi seems torn between the arc lights and the ministry files. He has desired to quit his ministerial post citing dwindling income. This is not the first time he has done so. Soon after he took an oath as a minister in the Narendra Modi Cabinet in 2024, Gopi had hoped that he would be relieved from his ministerial duties. Does his recurring wish to quit hint that the actor in him never fully gave way to the politician in him?

Day 4 Live: Kuldeep, Bumrah dampen WI comebackIndia (IND) vs West Indies (WI), 2nd Test Day 4 Live Score Updates: Kuldeep Yadav has struck thrice with the new ball, getting the better of Tevin Imlach, Roston Chase and Khary Pierre, and West Indies are slipping away after all the brilliant show this morning. Jasprit Bumrah has also got a wicket to his name after a long morning.

Karur stampede: Supreme Court orders CBI probe, blasts High Court over SIT orderThe Supreme Court transferred the Karur stampede case to the CBI, citing serious ramifications and fundamental rights concerns. A three-member supervisory committee, led by ex-judge Ajay Rastogi, will monitor the probe.

10,500 drug plants but only 1,467 inspectors: India's regulatory deficitIndia has about 10,500 drug manufacturing units operated by over 3,000 pharmaceutical companies. Yet, as of 2015, the country had only around 1,467 drug inspectors, less than half the over 3,000 needed, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare's reply to the Rajya Sabha (in 2015)

KBC contestant controversy: Schools, not just parents, are raising overconfident kidsWhile social media has been quick to blame parenting for a young contestant's overconfidence, the bigger culprit may be the schools themselves. Systems that reward assertiveness and quick answers over critical thinking, nurturing students who look confident but are often underprepared.

Live: Trump to address Israeli parliament shortly, all 20 hostages freed by HamasHamas is releasing the first group of remaining hostages held captive in Gaza. The International Committee of the Red Cross (ICRC) said on Monday that it had begun a multi-phase operation for the release of hostages in Gaza and Palestinian prisoners held by Israel, as part of a key prisoner exchange under the breakthrough ceasefire following two years of war. Palestinians are awaiting the release of hundreds of prisoners held by Israel. Stay tuned to India Today for the latest updates as this pivotal day for the Middle East unfolds.

Neither respect women: Karnataka Congress leaders compare RSS to TalibanCongress leaders Yatindra Siddaramaiah and Priyank Kharge compared RSS to the Taliban, citing restrictions on women and constitutional disregard. Kharge also urged Chief Minister Siddaramaiah to ban RSS activities in Karnataka government spaces.

You abused your position: What court said while charging Lalu Prasad in IRCTC scamA Delhi court has framed corruption, cheating, and conspiracy charges against Lalu Yadav, Rabri Devi, and Tejashwi Yadav, after the CBI accused the family of manipulating IRCTC tenders and illegal land transfers.

Abhishek dedicates Best Actor Award to Aishwarya, Aaradhya in emotional speechAbhishek Bachchan won his first Best Actor in a Leading Role (Male) award at the 70th Filmfare Awards for his performance in 'I Want To Talk.' The actor delivered an emotional speech, thanking his wife Aishwarya and daughter Aaradhya, highlighting their support and sacrifices.

Israeli man who saw his girlfriend killed by Hamas sets himself on fire, diesAt least 378 people, including 344 civilians were killed on October 7, 2023, when Hamas-led Palestinian militants crossed from Gaza into Israel and attacked the Nova open-air music festival and nearby communities. This unprecedented attack prompted Israel to wage its ongoing war against Hamas in Gaza.

TCS CEO says no new H-1B hires planned, company to focus on local US workforceTata Consultancy Services (TCS) is taking a clear stance on its US hiring strategy, with CEO K Krithivasan confirming that the company will not bring in new H-1B hires this financial year.

How Einstein is the reason your Google Maps knows where you areGlobal Positioning System (GPS) satellites continuously beam down ultra-precise timestamps, each message essentially saying, "It was 12:00:00.000001 when I sent this."
She plans, she books, she travelsA new report by Booking.com reveals that women are increasingly taking the lead in travel planning across Indian households.

Noida man claims Uber driver texted his friend after ride, sent 'creepy' messagesA Noida man shared screenshots showing how an Uber driver sent "creepy" WhatsApp texts to his friend after obtaining her number from the app.

Man takes 14-month-old Tripura girl on outing; rapes and buries her in fieldThe alleged rape took place on Saturday, following which she was "murdered and buried in a paddy field in the area", said Officer-in-Charge of Panisagar police station, Sumanta Bhattacharjee.

I'm good at solving wars: Denied Nobel, Trump now eyes Afghan-Pak conflictDonald Trump dismissed claims he sought a Nobel Prize, and again claimed credit for averting war between India and Pakistan through tariffs. He set off for Israel and Egypt to celebrate the US-brokered ceasefire and hostage deal.

Bentley begins a new chapter in India with new showrooms in Mumbai, BengaluruBritish luxury marque has strengthened its India presence with new retail and aftersales facilities under Skoda Auto Volkswagen India.

Video of young KBC contestant's behaviour sparks heated debate on social mediaYoung Ishit Bhatt's conduct on KBC 17 sparked strong reactions online. Many viewers criticised his overconfidence and questioned parental guidance, while others called for restraint and balanced judgement.
Indian woman claims her gold chain was snatched in Chicago, video sparks concernsAn Indian woman claimed that her gold chain was snatched in broad daylight in downtown Chicago.

Priyanka Gandhi seeks probe after Kerala techie's suicide due to 'RSS sexual abuse'Congress leader Priyanka Gandhi Vadra has demanded a full investigation after Kerala IT professional Anandu Aji was found dead, leaving a final social media post alleging repeated sexual abuse by multiple RSS members.

Preity Zinta-Bobby Deol's sweet pose sums up Diwali warmth at bash. VideoPreity Zinta and Bobby Deol's heartwarming reunion at Manish Malhotra's Diwali bash stole the spotlight. The 'Soldier' duo shared a friendly punch, warm hug, and surprise pose for the paparazzi, perfectly capturing the spirit of festive cheer and nostalgia.

Aishwarya Rai serves power in black, and her pants say it all: Walk your worthAishwarya Rai looked stunning in a black bandhgala at the Loreal show at Paris Fashion Week. However, it was her flared pants that did the talking.

sports.headline: India white-ball series ideal Ashes preparation: Australia captain Mitchell Marsh Mitchell Marsh believes Australia's white-ball series against India is perfect preparation for the 2025–26 Ashes, with the two sides always sharing a great rivalry. Facing world No. 1 India provides match intensity and competitive practice ahead of England's historic Test series in Perth.

Follow-on blunder? Gambhir slammed as India's 12-year streak ends in Delhi Test India vs West Indies, 2nd Test: Head coach Gautam Gambhir and captain Shubman Gill have faced flak for the decision to enforce follow-on in Delhi. West Indies put up an admirable fight with the bat in their second innings to force India to bat again, ending a 13-year-long streak.

At 14, Vaibhav Suryavanshi becomes vice-captain of Bihar Ranji Trophy team Vaibhav Suryavanshi, 14, has been named vice-captain of Bihar for the first two rounds of Ranji Trophy 2025-26, after exceptional youth performances in Australia, England and the IPL. Sakibul Gani will lead the side as Bihar aims to rebound from a winless previous season.

Zidane confirms eagerness to become France head coach: I'll get back Zinedine Zidane has confirmed his ambition to coach the France national team in the future. The former Real Madrid manager remains patient, focusing on returning to management at the right moment.

Harmanpreet Kaur slammed by fans after India's record loss to Australia: Time to go Harmanpreet Kaur is facing severe backlash after India's record World Cup defeat to Australia. Fans questioned her captaincy and poor batting form, demanding leadership changes as India's campaign continues to lose direction.

Alyssa Healy admits Smriti-Pratika had Australia scared in Vizag Women's World Cup, India vs Australia, Alyssa Healy press conference: Australia captain has admitted that she was hanging on for her dear life when India were piling on runs in Vizag. Healy said that sometimes as a captain you only hope that somehow things will get under control.

India working on batting issues, will fix dot ball problem: Amol Mazumdar Women's World Cup 2025: The Indian team is trying to fix is dot ball percentage issues, stressed head coach Amol Mazumdar after back to back defeats in the tournament. Mazumdar said that there would be big discussions about it before India's next match against England.

IND vs AUS: How India blunted out even before Australia clash Women's World Cup, IND vs AUS: India were tactically off the mark and poorly planned, resulting in a three-wicket loss to Australia. With plenty to reflect on, they now have thinking to do ahead of their clash against England on October 19 in Indore.

Day 4 Live: Kuldeep, Bumrah dampen WI comeback India (IND) vs West Indies (WI), 2nd Test Day 4 Live Score Updates: Kuldeep Yadav has struck thrice with the new ball, getting the better of Tevin Imlach, Roston Chase and Khary Pierre, and West Indies are slipping away after all the brilliant show this morning. Jasprit Bumrah has also got a wicket to his name after a long morning.

Alyssa Healy admits Smriti-Pratika had Australia scared in Vizag Women's World Cup, India vs Australia, Alyssa Healy press conference: Australia captain has admitted that she was hanging on for her dear life when India were piling on runs in Vizag. Healy said that sometimes as a captain you only hope that somehow things will get under control.

Mazumdar said that there would be big discussions about it before India's next match against England.

With plenty to reflect on, they now have thinking to do ahead of their clash against England on October 19 in Indore.

Jasprit Bumrah has also got a wicket to his name after a long morning.

How Alyssa Healy pulled off an all-time classic for AustraliaAlyssa Healy unfurled a sensational 142, a knock marked by both genius and grit, as she capitalised on India's inexperienced bowling attack to help Australia pull off an all-time classic at a packed Vizag Stadium.

Alyssa Healy on breaking free from rough patch: I was frustrated, out of rhythmWomen's World Cup: Alyssa Healy roared back to form with a stunning 142 off 107 balls, guiding Australia to a thrilling three-wicket win over India in the Women's World Cup clash at Visakhapatnam.

After batting collapse vs AUS, India coach says team has settled, flexible orderAfter the loss to Australia, India coach Amol Muzumdar said that his side's batting order is settled but can be flexible if needed. India failed to capitalise on their momentum and lost to the Aussies in the end.

Nahida Akter backs Nigar Sultana amid batting woes ahead of South Africa clashBangladesh spinner Nahida Akter has defended captain Nigar Sultana amid poor batting form in the Women's World Cup 2025. The team remains hopeful of a strong comeback in their next match against South Africa.

India head coach eyes bowling depth, addresses dot ball concerns post AUS lossIndia women's cricket team head coach Amol Muzumdar has said that the team will look to add bowling depth heading ahead in the tournament after their 3-wicket defeat against Australia in the Women's World Cup 2025.

Batting woes, 6th bowler issue: Harmanpreet Kaur says India has much to fixIndia captain Harmanpreet Kaur said that the late batting order collapse let the team down in their agonising loss to Australia in Vizag on Sunday, October 12. Australia secured a record win after chasing down 331 in 49 overs.

How Alyssa Healy negated Sree Charani threat to down IndiaWomen's World Cup, IND vs AUS: Alyssa Healy scored a match-winning 142 to lead Australia to a record run-chase of 331 against India, carefully targeting bowlers around key threat Sree Charani.

Alyssa Healy storm hits Vizag, sinks India in record chaseCaptain Alyssa Healy smashed a jaw-dropping 142 as Australia pulled off the highest-ever chase in women's ODI history, hunting down 331 against hosts India in front of a roaring crowd at the ACA-VDCA Stadium on a Super Sunday to remember.

India head coach eyes bowling depth, addresses dot ball concerns post AUS lossIndia women's cricket team head coach Amol Muzumdar has said that the team will look to add bowling depth heading ahead in the tournament after their 3-wicket defeat against Australia in the Women's World Cup 2025.

Batting woes, 6th bowler issue: Harmanpreet Kaur says India has much to fixIndia captain Harmanpreet Kaur said that the late batting order collapse let the team down in their agonising loss to Australia in Vizag on Sunday, October 12. Australia secured a record win after chasing down 331 in 49 overs.

How Alyssa Healy negated Sree Charani threat to down IndiaWomen's World Cup, IND vs AUS: Alyssa Healy scored a match-winning 142 to lead Australia to a record run-chase of 331 against India, carefully targeting bowlers around key threat Sree Charani.

Alyssa Healy storm hits Vizag, sinks India in record chaseCaptain Alyssa Healy smashed a jaw-dropping 142 as Australia pulled off the highest-ever chase in women's ODI history, hunting down 331 against hosts India in front of a roaring crowd at the ACA-VDCA Stadium on a Super Sunday to remember.

Premier League: Florian Wirtz's slow Liverpool start defended by NagelsmannGermany coach Julian Nagelsmann called for patience with Liverpool's Florian Wirtz as he struggles to adapt to the Premier League. The German midfielder is yet to record a goal or assist in his first seven league matches after arriving from Bayer Leverkusen for a club-record fee.

South Africa ready for tough spin challenge against Bangladesh: Tumi SekhukhuneSouth Africa seamer Temi Sekhukhune has said that they're wary of the Bangladesh spin challenge ahead of their clash in the Women's World Cup 2025 in Visakhapatnam.

Not dwelling too much on win over India, every game important for us: SekhukhuneSouth Africa seamer Tumi Sekhukhune said that they will not dwell too much on their thrilling victory against India and treat every game equally ahead of their fixture against Bangladesh in Visakhapatnam.

AIFF adopts new constitution, leaves out two clauses for SC clarification: ReportThe All India Football Federation has adopted the Supreme Court-approved constitution, leaving two contentious clauses pending. This move comes amid a FIFA deadline and ahead of the upcoming AIFF elections, creating uncertainty around governance reforms.

Kuldeep Yadav's mystery spinner element makes him dangerous: Ryan ten DoeschateIndia assistant coach Ryan ten Doeschate has said that the mystery spinner element makes Kuldeep Yadav a dangerous bowler after his fine performance in the Delhi Test. Kuldeep picked up five wickets against West Indies on Sunday, October 12.

IND vs WI: Did India plan to bat again in Delhi Test? Ten Doeschate respondsIndia's assistant coach Ryan ten Doeschate said that the hosts thought about batting again before enforcing the follow-on on West Indies during the Delhi Test. India bowled out West Indies for 248 in the first innings but struggled to get wickets in the second one.

Shan Masood, captain of India: Shaun Pollock makes big blunder on commentaryDuring live coverage of the opening Test between Pakistan and South Africa at Lahore's Gaddafi Stadium, former South Africa all-rounder Shaun Pollock mistakenly described Shan Masood as the 'captain of India.' The clip of the incident has been going viral on social media.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
